doc.field: This series contains 20 linear feet of files kept by Brademas' personal secretaries. Files are arranged alphabetically by subject. Materials reflect personal interests and endeavors by Brademas, publications by and about Brademas, membership with various boards and committees, travel with committees and congressional congregations as well as district visits, and accepted invitations. Correspondence files include communications between Brademas and personal friends, colleagues or constituent mail that was brought directly to Brademas' attention. Prominent correspondents include Thomas P. O'Neill, Costa Carras, Frank Thompson Jr., Douglas Davis, Bert Liss, Mort Linder, John Koumoulides, and Theodore Hesburgh.

Some material documents years before Brademas' congressional career. See early "Correspondence" and "Articles & Statements" as well as folders on "Biographical Information," "Application Material (Rhodes Scholarship, Harvard)," "Dissertation," "Methodist Work Camp," "Notes and Notebooks," and "Stevenson, Adlai: Executive Assistant Correspondence."
